Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for average price”
Reviews.Author: Szymon_1975
Reviews.Content: Although they declare availability of wi-fi throughout the hotel, it's not always working properly. The fron desk staff is not always helpful. The choice of breakfests is quite limited. Forget about any special view behing your window!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place to stay, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Simon0362
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days on a business trip and found it to be pleasant and functional without being anything special. The rooms were a good size for a city hotel and clean. The decor especially in the bathroom was a bit dated and gave the impression that it had last been renovated about 20 years ago - but everything was clean and functioned. The breakfast was ok, although a little dull - lots of breads, meats and some cereal, nothing much else. The coffee was not good. The staff on the front desk were helpful and proactive. If you like walking, take the road outside the hotel towards the city to find loads of bars, restaurants and tapas places within about a mile.

Reviews.Title: “Point of Departure”
Reviews.Author: rqbii
Reviews.Content: The Gran Atlanta is a good choice for access to metro, both to Barajas Airport and Madrid City center. Located in a business and upper middle class neighborhood, the hotel is nothing special, the walls thin, exposing guests to the conversations of neighbors and hallway chatter. The breakfast was acceptable. I found the breakfast room host abrupt and somewhat obtrusive, and the cloth napkins provided smelled absolutely revolting, although they appeared to be clean were pressed. The odor combined with the very dark green color convinced me not to touch them, much less use them for the purpose napkins are generally provided. As a stopover to or from the airport and escape from the hustle and bustle of the historic district, the Gran Atlanta is a good choice, particularly if one relies on public transportation..

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: carlosochoa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the station "Nuevos Ministerios" which allows you to access it directly from the airport, and to reach the center of Madrid in 20 minutes (taking into account all the walking inside the station). It is on a street that carries not much traffic. Staff is polite and helpful, and they do their job efficiently Despite that, the hotel needs a good updating so one can feel there is something different from a 3-star hotel, even 2. It is like entering back into the 80s or 70s, however, make no mistake since everything works as it did back then. Single rooms are very small, and the bedding felt quite dusty. At least there is no insulation problem, on the contrary, windows had to be left open to let air enter. Breakfast was abundant and well presented. However, they open strictly until 7.30am. For business visitors, this is not early enough if one needs to ride the metro to the outskirts of Madrid. If it could start at 7am, would be great. There is wifi in the entire hotel, and works adequately. TV has a rather poor choice of channels, the safe is the type where you have to put a coin to get your key.

Reviews.Title: “Repeated guest - shall stay again”
Reviews.Author: Raissa H
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from my 5-night visit to Madrid. I stayed in this hotel on previous occasions, and it was re-assuring to see familiar smiling faces at the reception desk. The staff are polite, friendly, helpful and most with good command of English ( though not a must in my case as I am fluent in Spanish ). The hotel is in excellent location, withing a walking distance from Metro and one of the biggest department stores. Also is well connected by bus service with the historic Old Madrid centre. Rooms are clean and well serviced daily. They are on a smaller side, but overall it is a very good value hotel. Shall definitely stay there again and would recommend it for visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jules M
Reviews.Content: For a four-star-hotel, the hotel seems to be a bit old and so it is not like the new ones that share the same number of stars. So if you expect a modern four star hotel, this is not it. The decoration is, I would say, from the 70s or early 80s. I stayed in a single room which was small but enough for one person. It was clean. The same decoration here. The hotel is located in a very nice neighbourhood and it is not far from two metro stations. It is 30 minutes away from the airport and downtown madrid is also about 30 minutes away. I

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amir_said7
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice location at the area of santiago Bernabu stadium. it's also near the commercial towers in madrid and around it a nice shopping area with all the shops zara, H&M, Massimo Dutti and more. the staff is not very helpfull but they are ok. the rooms are ok and include a minibar. the A/C is somehow weak. no wireless coverage. but at the overall the hotel is average

Reviews.Title: “One of Madrid Surviving Old hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregntrees
Reviews.Content: A hotel that already passed their golden moment. Clean in general, quite friendly staff but their in between vintage and old atsmophere gives you a strange sense of feeling. Quite bad bathroom ventilation system but clean again give you another strange feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for short stays”
Reviews.Author: Lipi T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night. It was nice because of location, its right in the city center. If you are in Madrid for long visits, then may be not! The hotel has very suffocated feel to it, atleast my room was big but only one window showing the next hotel wall. Although the waiting lounge and guest areas are nice! Overall average rating from me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Anthony Z
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 days 03/11/2011 till 08/11/2011 as you can see I left the hotel 2 days ago, it was a nice stay at this hotel, cheap,good location,quiet area, reasonable room, good breakfast and a very friendly staff. I will recommend this hotel to all kind of generation. Thanks Hotel Gran Atlanta and Galahotels.com Best Wishes Anthony Zarb

Reviews.Title: “Save your money and book into a hostel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne R
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say this is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. I would love to know who saw fit to give it a 4 star rating, 2 stars would be far more appropriate. The smell in the rooms and the halls was awful, the beds were unbelievably uncomfortable,and I wont even mention the 'view' from the window. There were no in room facilities for making tea or coffee and the tv barely worked. You could hear guests in adjacent rooms talking and flushing toilets. The breakfast was a joke and ridiculously over-priced for what was on offer. The staff could barely understand a word of English!!! Luckily we arrived at 6 oclock in the evening and left at 7 am the following morning. Just save your money, and sleep on a park bench instead!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Atlanta - a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: sparklesKent_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, but noisy and for all the reasons listed does not merit the 4 stars it advertises and the breakfast is over priced. No facilities are available at night, for example I arrived late and could not get fresh milk from the hotel. The worst thing however was, that the hotel did not communicate properly in advance of my stay, did not reply to an email sent several days before my visit changing my room from a double to a single, and for the same room type as my colleague occupied for 50 euro per night charged me 120 euro per night for a double occupancy even through the room was single occupied, and the double room had been cancelled. As it is a twin room, only one bed had been used, so reducing the cleaning costs, so the increased costs were not even justifyable. I felt this hotel was dishonest and disrespectful. DO NOT give them your money. I would NOT recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly, unhelpful, rude, arrogant, smart-mouthed, stuffy Hot & smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travellersgjfda
Reviews.Content: PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE--do yourself a favor and buy a cardboard box and sleep on the street; that way you will at least know that you will not be pushed by staff who are trying to walk past you; have people walk away from you in mid conversation; or have rooms that smell and have no air conditioner in 37c heat! I have studied law in 6 countries and travel extensively so I know what budget hotels and student accommodation is like. This is worse. I hope this place is bought out by a large corporate to be either blown up or turned into a storage facility for nuclear waste-at least that way it might get rid of the smell!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: kpauljevic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty good. I stayed during world youth day so it was fairly busy everywhere. Its not the greatest hotel on the inside (the wifi cuts out, the beds r lumpy and theres no pool. But it's close to metro stations (one that goes to the airport), the real Madrid stadium and a big dept store. Also, u get a nice buffet breakfast for cheap and the people r helpful at the desk and they speak English! I probly wouldn't stay again but its not too bad to stay for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely look for something else next time”
Reviews.Author: MikeElangelo
Reviews.Content: This is so not a 4 star hotel. I stayed two times, one week distance. The first time I had a non-smoking room with street view. It was clear, large and clean. The second time I could only get a smoking room. The smell was bad, the view was towards an interior yard, noisy and very small. As for the other facilities, there is no free WiFi, no swimming pool (How can you pretend to be a 4 star hotel without swimming pool?). The breakfast was fair enough, with good services, but the restaurant was pretty small and hence very crowded. Other than that, the location of the hotel is a good one, within 5 minutes of walking of two metro stations. Two of the reception guys were friendly and eager to help, but the other one was grumpy and suspicious. In conclusion, even if my first experience was a good one, I definitely expected more from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Its a good hotel and i have no problem going back there again”
Reviews.Author: tamerEltal
Reviews.Content: Its not a bad hotel , i read reviews about people saying its old and has a smell in the rooms .. actually i didn't see that . Rooms are clean and tidy , there Are smoking / non-smoking rooms too . The service is good comparing to a 4 star hotel . The location of the hotel is great , its not in the heart of Madrid , but u can go there by metro, 1 euros per person . It takes about 4 minutes there by metro . Its also near the Santiago Bernabeu Stadium , for those who doesn't know that , its the stadium of Real Madrid Football Club , actually that was my main reason i went to Spain , and exactly to the Hotel Gran Atlanta . Everything you might need is available around you , restaurants , bars , malls , coffee shops , clothing shops... etc . The breakfast is good , many food options , and the food service is very good . its located in a calm area , the street is calm and you don't hear noises at night . The staff are friendly and they speak English , not that good but at least you can communicate with them. It has internet WI-Fi , but its not for free , i didn't use it actually so i cant say if its fast or slow . The hotel prices are reasonable . So i hope that i gave you a good review about Hotel Gran Atlanta . I hope you enjoy your visit to Spain as i did .

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location but basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: yano23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us through work and was selected because it was both cheap and close to the Madrid Palacio de Congres Conference Centre. It is also very close to the Santiago Bernabeu football stadium. It is located in a quiet leafy street in a nice neighbourhood, about 2 miles north of the centre of Madrid. We had read the TripAdvisor reviews beforehand so expected the worst. It really wasn't that bad, but undoubtedly you get what you pay for. If you arrive expecting 3/4 star accommodation then you will be disappointed. If you want a basic, clean cheap to stay then you will be happy enough. The decor is pretty odd and very dated. It really feels like about 1975. The room I had was pretty small with only a view to an internal courtyard and a very hard basic bed. I slept ok but it wasn't ideal. We didn't spend a lot of time in the rooms and trust me you won't want to either! However, the air con is on in the summer and works well which is a great relief when it is 30 degrees+ outside. The staff are friendly enough and I thought the breakfast was good. Plenty to go around and quite a few different options. We didn't bother to pay for the wifi because it seemed slow - it is provided by an external company Telefonica. All in all there are positives as well as negatives and although I wouldn't go back it was ok as a base for a few days in Madrid on business. You have to be realistic - whatever they say this is not a 4 Star hotel but rather a decent basic clean place with a price to match.

Reviews.Title: “Overnighters only. Not a holiday hotel. But kitsch and conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: GRW007
Reviews.Content: Wow. Where to start. This is basically an acceptable enough hotel for short stays for business travel, as long as you don't mind the fact that the facilities are very dated, and the rooms are a bit cramped. The hotel looks like it was decorated in the mid-1970s and hasn't changed a bit. For example, there are ashtrays in the lifts (despite there being a no smoking sign in there too), brown stained-wood panelling everywhere and faded pictures of the company's other hotels plastered all over the lobby, and the many flags outside the lobby have seen better days. I actually got rather fond of its kitsch look after a few days there - it generally has the look of a government building in a banana republic of some kind. But I don't think that's what the owners were going for! Although the rooms have all the necessities, I wouldn't consider it a real four-star hotel. The breakfast is okay, and the place is certainly very clean and it seems safe, but you wouldn't want to spend so much time in the rooms as they are rather small and have no views (unless you like looking at felt roofing panels and stairwells). If you need somewhere conveniently located and cheap in Madrid for a night or so Positives: * Very cheap * Great location near the conference centre and two metro stops. On a quiet street but very accessible. * Very clean * Decent breakfast * Friendly enough staff (but limited language skills) Negatives: * Not the best beds * Noisy A/C (but it is efficient) * Cramped rooms * No WiFi * It's not 1973, and zircon chandeliers and brown wood panelling aren't in vogue! * Not ideal for a romantic getaway, unless you are DCI Gene Hunt and/or have large sideburns and wear a brown leather jacket and flares :)

Reviews.Title: “This is not a four star hotel by any stretch of the imagination”
Reviews.Author: grotpaws
Reviews.Content: The room was small and cramped. There was a horrible smell of must in the wardrobes , on bedspread and in the room and no matter how long window was open for the smell would just not go. When air conditioning worked the smell of must was even worse. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast ws average but you need to get there early. Would say that this hotel is more suitable as a 2 star. Location was good. The beds were extremely uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel poor breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Fortalezakaj
Reviews.Content: You would stay here for the price only. Breakfast was extremely disappointing. The hotel itself is OK the rooms are nothing fancy but functional. This is the kind of hotel where you do not stay in the room and watch a movie. Bathrooms are OK my room had a bathtub for those enjoying that extra feature.

Reviews.Title: “Good price in the centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Pribina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is under construction right now, so it's little bit noisy during the day. The price is excellent, also great position near the city center, near the Bernabeu stadium, also the airport is close, about 25 minutes by taxi. The room is small, but nice and clean. People who works here can speak English very well. Taxi stand is just in front of the hotel. Only problem I was facing was that wi-fi internet by Telefonica was extremely slow. When checking the bandwidth it was about 128k, what is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Hello 1970s”
Reviews.Author: StealthIdiot
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks as if it was in its prime in the 1970s. The lobby looks like grandma's living room; at least the furniture does not have protective plastic covers. I stayed in a single room; it was pretty small and sound readily penetrated the walls. The room was reasonably clean but the quilt on the bed was in need of replacement. Perhaps things are different in Europe but by American standards this is most definitely not a four-star hotel. All that said, it was pretty inexpensive. Next time I'm in Madrid I will try and find another hotel but if I'm stuck here it won't be so bad.

Reviews.Title: “What horrible beds this hotel has!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ciclido
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Hotel Gran Atlanta and I totally shared the impression that this is not a 4 Star Hotel. Please note: 1. The beds are horrible!!!! I travel lots for work and I have stayed in hotels between 3 and 5 stars. From the best to the not so great. This is the first time in my life that I encounter a place with such hard beds. The matresses do not have padding and you can actually feel the metals from inside the bed on your back. I have cramps all over my back. After two hours of laying in bed I cannot sleep anymore. All hotels I have been in have some sort of duvet or padding between the matress and the sheets so you do not fee like this. These matresses do not have that. The Front Desk Clerc gave 10 keys to visit 10 different rooms and ALL THE BEDS ARE THE SAME. 2. It is winter time and the heating sistem seems to be centralized or not really good. It is way too hot and I am actually not using any sheets over my body because I feel over heated. There is a thermostat but it does not seem to work. No matter the temperature I choose, the room feels exactly the same. I could turn it off but then I am afraid of feeling cold and wake up again not for the bed but this time because I am cold. 3. The breakfast is not so great either. They do not have those trays with the flames underneath to keep the food warm. So they prepare the eggs and if you get there one hour after the eggs have been prepared then you have to eat them cold. I have to say though that the selection is quite complete. 4. There is no gym!!! Again, 4 stars??? 5. There is no bell boy and there is no ramp between the entry level and the lobby. When I arrived I had to carry a heavy luggage down the stairs with no help. Not an easy task. 6. TV are 13 inches. Again, 4 stars with these tvs!!!!! 7. Just one telephone per room. 4 Star hotels should have a telephone next to bed, another one on the desk and another one (I think this is optional) in the bathroom. 8. No iron nor iron board!!!! However they have this stupid trouser's iron system. I am supposed to send my shirts for ironing to their laundry service which is just available before 10 am and they bring it back after 6 pm. What if you arrive at night and you need some stuff ironed for the following day of work???? 9. You have to put a coin in the safe, otherwise it does not release the key and you cannot lock it. I could go on and on and on with the things I have noticed in my two night stay here. I have been trying to get my company to move me to a Holiday Inn where I know the service will be very much standard and where I am pretty familiar with the beds, but the person who arranged my stay here pre-paid my stay, which happens to be of 7 nights, and they refuse to give us our money back. So, if any of these points, if not all, are of any importance to you, then run Forest run!!!! You should not stay here!!! Not even in backpacking hotels in Vietnam I remember having such crappy beds. Regards to all, A cranky customer that cannot sleep in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Not 4 STARS!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: London1188
Reviews.Content: After staying at the hotel, I can comment that it is definately not a 4 stars hotel! The room deco needs upgrading and one advise from me, dont ever consider rooms on second floor especially those room that has the window facing other rooms. If the guests known to each other, they can actually talk to each other without actually leaving their doors. This is not bad if your room is on 3rd of 4th Floor as you can only hear voices. During my stayed, I was given Room 201 and guess what hey... I am on second floor! Even though it is meant to be a 4 stars hotel, there is no aircond nor fan! and I have to open the window for ventilation and air as it was quite hot on that day. Guess what.. in the middle of the night, some drunken people decided to scream and shout and I can hear them walking on the secluded flat roof. It was noisy and the worst part was the drunken man decided to peep through curtain of my room!!!! AWFUL!!! didn't manage to get any sleep on my 1st night!!! The second night was much much better because I could relax and guess what, the window remain shut as couldn't risk someone climbing into my room! Overall... it is a budget hotel with all the basic definately lack of investment. Don't expect any 4 stars treatments!

Reviews.Title: “Neutral Average Place and NOT 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Hudzik
Reviews.Content: Just an average hotel with a nice lobby. The rooms are just ok, nothing special. Breakfast staff not very friendly and either is the front desk staff. Breakfast is good. Don't pay more than $100 for this place. The location is pretty good. Close to the Nuevos Ministerios metro stop. Not impressed, but not too disappointed. Would I stay here again? I would look for something else.

Reviews.Title: “good deal nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: avsidolfor
Reviews.Content: just back from weekend in madrid stayed at the gran atlanta hotel. Hotel is undergoing renovation due to be finished in november2008, overall nice hotel in excellent location close to three metro stations and real madid football ground ,plenty of bars n restaurants nearby would have no hesitation in going back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: razm
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were in Madrid from 28.12.2007 to 02.01.2008. The Gran Atlanta hotel is located in a nice and quiet neighborhood, but it is an old hotel that needs to be refurbished. I think the hotel is overvalued, expensive for the level of comfort and more like 3 star hotel because even a restaurant is not available! From airport you need about 30 minutes by metro till Nuevos ministerios metro station (direct line) and then you have to walk about 15 minutes till you reach the hotel. From the hotel the nearest metro station is Alvarado (10 min. walking) and this is direct line to Sol station; you need about 20 min. by metro to Sol station. The location it’s a little bit far from downtown! The personnel was friendly and helpful. The room was basic, large and clean with old furniture, but if you want to visit the city you won’t spend too much time in the room. For the breakfast we had always the same food, fresh but not diversified and without any vegetables (!) and they served us only oranges. Around the hotel you will find a lot of restaurants and El Corte Ingles shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Poor imitation of a 4star hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlyDublin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Gran Atlanta hotel and we were very disappointed with the hotel. We booked this last minute break with The Travel Department and it was cheap but it is still advertised as a four star hotel which it is does not deserve. This is a 3 star hotel at best. The hotel itself is very clean and the rooms are serviced and cleaned daily. But the hotel is very dated with none of the facilities we have come to expect with a four star.There is no restaurant and the staff are extremely unfriendly and unapproachable and never believe in smiling. The Travel Department rep was very helpful and friendly though. The hotel is a distance away from the city centre for a short break but it is well serviced by local transport. Bus and metro stations close by and a taxi rank outside which costs approx 10 euro into town. There are shops and restaurants close by. But i would not recommend this hotel to anyone of any age. I have booked a further summer holiday with this agent and i sincerely hope that it is much better quality than my first stay with them. Madrid itself is a beautiful city with loads to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: cartoonfans
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very pleasant stay in this hotel. The room was very clean, nicely furnished and well equipped with television, trouser press, hairdryer, minibar, etc. The staff were all helpful although a lot of them didn't speak much English. We had a problem with the bathroom light one morning and this was fixed while we had breakfast, Breakfast was included in our deal and was a buffet with plenty of choice. We found it very easy to get around as the Metro was near by and a tourist day ticket with unlimited travel in the centre of Madrid was only 4 euros. There were plenty of bars and restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel. We had read that the hotel was an expensive place to access the internet so we found a place just round the corner which charged 50 cents for 10 minutes and another 40 cents to print out our boarding passes for the flight home. Compared with what we were quoted for other hotels in Madrid we definitely found a bargain this time.

Reviews.Title: “Staff put us in harms way intentionally...”
Reviews.Author: GlobalWorktraveler
Reviews.Content: I had read other reviews of this hotel and had reservations about about staying at the Gran Atlanta but had decided that maybe it was just a budget hotel and that the other travelers that had posted negative reviews were not prepared for a budget Euro hotel. My experience was horrible at this hotel. My wife and I arrived quite late in the evening (11:30pm or so), there was no porter to assist us with our luggage even though we obviously struggled with it ourselves (I didnt expect help anyway, not such a complaint). When we checked in the man behind the counter couldn't care less that we were there and didn't make eye contact with either of us during the entire duration of the check in. We asked if there was somewhere nearby that we could eat food and the guy behind the counter laughed at us and then produced a map and showed us while chuckling to himself a place that might still be open. We found this odd but dismissed it. The hotel room was not very nice (again I expected this so more informational than a complaint) and it didnt give me the feeling of safety in my hotel room, cant explain why. I had misplaced the map the staff member had given me but he had refused to provide me with another one when I had asked. I managed to spend some time in the room and eventually found it and then departed at about midnight to the restaurant recommendation that he had given us. The area is not so nice around the hotel at night and the deadbeat guy behind the counter must have thought he was playing a pretty funny joke on us by sending us to a very very seedy and unsafe area full of prostitutes and drug dealers. We didnt make it all the way to the restaurant because we felt unsafe and wanted to go back to the relative safety of the hotel but from a distance the "restaurant" looked to be a strip club... I travel constantly for my own business so am no stranger to hotels on the cheaper side but have never ever been experienced to such an event at any establishment. To purposely put a guest in harms way for ones amusement is in no way acceptable. Also, this is the first time that I have posted a review to trip advisor even though I use it often to scope out places to stay. In short, I am rarely the complainer but thought that I should share my experience with others. We checked out early the next morning. I would recommend against staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Damaged my luggage-no refund”
Reviews.Author: Steno1
Reviews.Content: Very bad experience. My luggage left at the hotel's deposit room was heavily damaged. The staff manager present at the time, Mr. Alvaro Mayoral, refused to take any responsability. He provided an email which never replied to my requests of refund. It was also very hard to get his name, he was very elusive and refused repeatedly to write it on a piece of paper. (As far as I know he may have given me a fake name..) Very unpleasant experience, strongly not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to shops & san siro stadium. Reccomended.”
Reviews.Author: Daveyboy03
Reviews.Content: First things first. My stay at the gran atlanta hotel in november 2006 was excellent ! I have stayed in many 3* & 4* hotels in europe & found this to be great value for money. Despite what other reviews may have commented on, i would definitely recommend this hotel. I spent most of the day touring madrid, & used the mini bar facilities in the evening, rather than visit the many bars in the vicinity. (The prices were very reasonable & included champagne.) The hotel is not centrally located but is close to the san siro stadium which is very handy if your stay includes watching Real Madrid FC. The breakfast on offer was very good & plentiful. The foyer is very glam looking as you enter & i had little problem being understood as one of the receptionists spoke english. I found the room to be clean & spacious & just what i needed for my short stay. There are 3 metro stations nearby to choose from,: Nuevos Ministerios the nearest, takes you directly to the airport in 20 minutes. There are also many shops nearby & at least 2 main shopping streets. This hotel offered me value for money & delivered & if your budget is tight this is a great hotel to stay. 9/10 !

Reviews.Title: “Totally unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: bass-baritone77
Reviews.Content: An absolute disgrace -- filthy, smelly, cold. How can a reputable travel agency recommend such a place?

Reviews.Title: “Gran Atlanta - good choice!”
Reviews.Author: KDMG
Reviews.Content: Pleasant Stay! I stayed at the Hotel Gran Atlanta in Madrid from the 30th September to the 11th October. Through Otel.com I secured a good online deal of 60 Euros per day which included breakfast. The hotel is situated in a quiet tree-lined street in a residential/small business area of what is known as the financial district of Madrid. There are a number of little parks in the vicinity of the hotel as well as cafés and restaurants which primarily exist to service the locals. The small supermarkets near the hotel were very handy for purchasing bottled water, toiletries and snacks. There are two internet cafes situated up a side street directly opposite the entrance to the hotel. If you don’t have your own computer I suggest you use these as the single terminal available at the hotel is rarely functioning and is also very expensive. The hotel is situated approximately 500 metres from Nuevo Ministeros Metro. The Metro operates a line from Barajas International Airport directly to Nuevo Ministeros. Take the free shuttle bus from Terminal 4 to Terminal 2 and the Metro from Terminal 2 directly to Nuevo Ministeros. The cost of the ticket is 1 Euro. There are a number of exits at Nuevo Ministeros. In order to shorten your journey to the Hotel exit at the Orense exit (Calle de Orense). Walk up the Calle de Orense as far as the Calle Bascillca, situated on the left hand side. Walk across Calle de Orense and Calle General Moscardo, and along Calle Basicillca into Calle del Commandate Zorita. The entrance of the Gran Atlanta Hotel is in this street. The room was clean and serviced on a daily basis. The single bed was adequate, and there was more than enough storage space. A feature that was appreciated was a pay safe costing 1 Euro. A bar fridge is stocked with various drinks and sweets. A list provided enables you to record the items you consume. The television has a number of channels, two of which are in English, namely CNN and BBC news. The bathroom consisted of a toilet, hand basin and a bath with overhead shower. The air-conditioning WHEN IT WORKED was effective. Unfortunately it only worked on 2 of the 11 days of my stay. Without the airco the heat in the room was very oppressive. The hotel was surprisingly quiet in spite of successive tour buses arriving with loads of tourists who stayed for a few nights at a time. Breakfast was perfectly adequate and consisted of the following self service buffet: fruit juices, fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, cold meats (ham and salami) and slices of cheese, croissants and pastries, toast, cereals, yogurts, cold tortillas, the "doughnut" dough bread popular with the Spanish and coffee. English is not widely spoken by the staff but they are most helpful and assisted me with all my requests including the selecting and booking of tours, arranging for the tours buses to collect me at the hotel and also with helpful suggestions on getting around the city. Although most of the residents of Madrid I encountered spoke little if any English, I experienced no difficulty in obtaining the services I required, whether a ticket at the Metro or ordering a meal at a Café, in spite of my not being able to speak any Spanish. I was very satisfied that I had chosen this hotel, in this part of the city rather than one of those downtown in the noisier, more heavily “touristed” parts.

Reviews.Title: “A real disaster”
Reviews.Author: IVK
Reviews.Content: It seems that the personnel of this hotel does not understand English - I used the wakeup service 3 times, and 2 times out of three they woke me up at a wrong time. The latrine and the whole room was smelly when I entered the room, so I had to ask the reception to have it washed. It looks that ALL the single rooms have windows that face a narrow well inside the building that has almost no air circulation. The personnel lied to me on the day of arrival when they promised to change me tomorrow to another room with a window to the street; on the next day, however, another person informed me that they have NO single rooms with windows to the street. The personnel did not help us to call a taxi at 8:30 in the morning, and after waiting for more than 30 minutes at a taxi stop in front of the hotel we had to take the metro and got there very late for for appointment.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: unfrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: I had some misgivings about staying in this place, in part because of the suspiciously low tariffs charged in spite of its 4 star rating. The hotel is not centrally located, but access to the main tourist areas is not a problem as it is a mere 5 minute walk from the nearest metro stop. Access to and from the airport is also easy. I would say that the room given to me was adequate and funtional, and the fitness centre on the top floor was looking the worse for wear. The breakfast, which was included in the tariff, was very substantial. All in all I would say the hotel was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Atlanta Hotel in August 2005. We booked the hotel via Bancotel for €50 a night. In our view the hotel was very good for this money. Small and a little outdated rooms but clean. The staff was very helpful. The Bancotel rate included a very good buffet breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced, Under Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was staying at this hotel for a recent conference. It is located in the business district and costs about 70Euros (single). However for the price i expected a lot more. It had small dingy rooms, Old busted out showers and walls that were as thin as paper. I could here people getting up and going around their business all night!! There are much better hotels around, the only reason i would recommend this one is if you really really need to be in the business area.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Gran Atlanta
HotelInfo.Address: C/Comandante Zorita, 34, 28020 Madrid, Spain
